results.title: Locomotion
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Jones Films, British Transport Films and Geoffrey Jones
results.brief_description: Documentary celebrating 100 years of British railway history and the opening of the world’s first steam hauled public railway, the Stockton and Darlington Line. Its first engine became known as “Locomotion”. Uses collections of prints and sketches of people and architectural sights from a variety of museums and archival and picture libraries in the United Kingdom.

results.title: Lock, stock and two smoking barrels [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Summit Entertainment, Ska Films, Matthew Vaughn and Guy Ritchie
results.brief_description: When four small time London cons pool their savings for a high-rolling illegal card game with local crime boss Hatchet Harry, things don’t quite go as confidently anticipated. The four friends end up owing him half a million pounds with only a week to pay it off under threat of systematic loss of fingers if they fail to do so. As they engage in robbery, deception and double crossing involving their criminal next door neighbours, powerful drug barons and Harry himself to get the money, circumstances spiral surrealistically out of their control. The situation is further complicated by confusion over two valuable antique guns that Hatchet Harry has purchased, and which are mistakenly directed for use in pulling a ‘job’. The four hapless friends muddle through the seedy underside of London and an unwittingly created gang war in a collection of comic moments and misunderstandings balanced seamlessly with more serious elements. This is a tightly structured film with a cleverly twisted plot and striking rhythmic visuals and editing that, combined with the soundtrack, can be likened to the best of music videos. Cast includes Jason Flemyng, Dexter Fletcher, Nick Moran, Jason Stratham and Steven Mackintosh.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Summit Entertainment, Ska Films, Matthew Vaughn and Guy Ritchie

results.title: Loch Lomond
results.creator_credit: IFA (Scotland), Films of Scotland and Laurence Henson
results.brief_description: A study of human and wild life throughout the year, in, on, and around Loch Lomond. Gives a picture of the life and work of a Highland community - the wild life conservator, research biologist, shepherd, farmer and publican, all of whom know the Loch in its many moods.

results.title: Local traffic: a suburban dilemma
results.brief_description: Sandringham is a suburb where through traffic is causing problems in local streets. The program follows the process whereby residents press their local council to take action on the problem. A firm of consultants is appointed and we see the following five stages at work: the study, the proposal, the survey, the debate and the outcome.

results.title: Local newspaper
results.brief_description: The story of a typical local newspaper - an actual one, the Newbury Weekly News - and of the market town community it serves. Mr Hugh Turner, the editor, a familiar figure in the town, directs the paper, as his father did before him, independently of any big financial group and without fear or favour. The weekly newspaper, local in ownership and range of interests, goes out to be read eagerly and talked over throughout the whole community.

results.title: Local interest
results.brief_description: An overview of the developmental work of the six school support centres in the Southern Metropolitan Region in 1988. Managers explain the various programs being undertaken in the region and the cooperation between schools and the community.

results.title: Local Hero
results.brief_description: A story about the Dallas-style dramas that disturb a quaint Scottish village when a Houston-based oil company plan to buy the seaside town and turn its beach into a refinery site. Contrary to expectations, the eccentric local residents are only too eager to oblige with the sale of their homes. Starring Burt Lancaster.

results.title: Local 100
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, James Beveridge and Bernard Devlin
results.brief_description: The story of how Local 100, an affiliate of a national union, was formed. The sudden dismissal of an employee makes the others realise their lack of job security, and discussion of this problem leads to the suggestion that they organise a trade union. The film relates the steps that followed - the approach to the national union, the assistance given by an organiser from union headquarters, and the signing up of the workers which resulted in Local 100 being declared the legal bargaining authority. We see, too, how collective bargaining was carried on to obtain a contract providing job security and improved conditions. The democratic procedure followed throughout proves the contention that free trade unionism is one of the strongest pillars of democracy.

results.title: Loads on structures
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Robert Heller discusses static and dynamic loads. He describes the deformations and stresses that they are produced by dynamic oscillation and presents news footage which shows the disastrous effects of loads on structures. Includes scenes of the collapse of the Tacoma Narrows bridge;”Years 7-12”

results.title: Lloyds of London
results.creator_credit: World Wide and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: In a television interview lloyd’s chairman, Sir Matthew Drysdale answers various questions concerning the historical origins, development and present day functions of Lloyds of London. The interviewer is Robert McKenzie and to illustrate the discussion, scenes of activities, past and present, are included.
